ratings.comment: LOVED this professor! I had no background in any of these topics and before this class, feared and dreaded literature. Explains books in detail, gives good feedback on papers and is not looking for a specific conclusions in your writing - just your opinion, backed up. Too bad he is retiring. UW will miss you!
Very interesting, non-rigorous class on Vladmir Nabokov. Prof. Dolinin doesn't extensively go into literary analysis but is an interesting class nonetheless

Two 10-pg papers worth 80% of your grade. Enough said However, most people did well, easy grader Lectures aren't mandatory but I never skipped because I loved going! Dr. Dolinin knows so much! He is such a cute old man Quizzes aren't hard if you attend lecture You do not need to be an English major to do well here TAKE THIS CLASS FAM

I took this in spring of 2015. He has interesting points on the books, although the lectures can be dry at times. He asks students' opinions near the end of class, which is good. His quizzes are pretty easy if one fully reads the books. Some of the books, though, are not very interesting in my opinion. His accent is not bad at all.

Dolinin is incredibly knowledgeable (I ran across his name in scholarly articles by chance) and his lectures are interesting. He's very soft -spoken and mispronounces some words, but if you actively listen, you won't have a problem understanding . His life is ridiculously long and cool,  he brings real-life context to the stories he teaches.
If you're reading this and trying to decide whether or not to take a class with Dolinin, DO IT!

Heavy accent, but definitely a joy to take lecture with. The class could have been very difficult, but he's a pretty lenient grader. He was born in the USSR and has some genuinely interesting stories. (Stop and talk with him during office hours!) Would recommend this class.

DO NOT read Nabakov on your own, you'll miss out on the brilliant multi-dimensioned genius  of his books. Dolinin's a pleasure,  loves what hes teaching, always laughs with the class. His essays are fairly open ended and his quizzes aren't that bad if you read (dont take the class if u dont wanna read).Put in average effort youll get a B at least.

A really interesting class. Dolinin is a renowned Nabokov scholar and his wealth of knowledge reflects that. His insights and interpretations were always interesting. He frequently laughs at his own jokes and stutters a bit, but a really nice guy. Your grade is based entirely on two papers, so you better do well on them.

This class is INCREDIBLE! I highly recommend it. It definitely changed the way I read and analyze literature, and Professor Dolinin is amazingly intelligent. He always makes lecture interesting and interactive. I actually ENJOYED going to class. Dolinin's genius is amazing. I would eagerly take another course with him.

I highly recommend this class.  Be prepared to do A LOT of reading.  Like others have mentioned, the quizzes are very difficult, but don't worry too much, grades are mostly determined by the three papers, if you attend class, read the novels and write original thoughtful papers you will do well.

Like everyone else has said, excellent prof, incredibly knowledgeable and excited about what he teaches. Fun and engaging to listen to.  Very interesting and helpful lectures. Insanely difficult quizzes.

If you attend every lecture, Dolinin's genius will unfold before your eyes. Took some time for me to get used to his digressing lecture style, but he is a Nabokov scholar and therefore has a lot to say about the author. A wealth of knowledge. Very lenient grader, funny, sarcastic, wise, approachable. TAKE THIS CLASS! It changed the way I read!

If you attend every lecture, Dolinin's genius will unfold before your eyes. Took some time for me to get used to his digressing lecture style, but he is a Nabokov scholar and therefore has a lot to say about the author. A wealth of knowledge. Very lenient grader, funny, sarcastic, wise, approachable. TAKE THIS CLASS! It changed the way I read!

Here's the thing about Dolinin: he's interesting, excited about what he's teaching, and anxious for students to love Nabokov as much as he does. But his teaching has zero effect on your grade. Several ridiculous quizzes on the minutia of the books. Two 10 page papers that he doesn't read or grade. Read Nabokov on your own. Great novels, bad class.
amazing

You have no idea how great this professor is until you've taken one of his classes. Very kind, intelligent, and funny. He's not like most of the other snobby professors at UW. I would definitely take another one of his classes, even if the quizzes are brutal.
Very good professor!!! Lectures are very interesting but his quizzes are tough (he will give quotes from the book and you have to say who said it). Would definately recomend him to other people.
Very helpful, knowledgeable, and understanding.

This was the first class I ever took, and listening to Dolinin's first lecture made me so excited for college classes. He is insanely knowledgeable about the readings, and although there are a lot of them, they are all awesome books. I can not imagine having a better or more friendly professor, and I felt guilty missing lecturesANTONELLAISTHEBESTTA
A tremendous teacher, the best I've had at Madison.  A really nice guy, very knowledgeable, with a clear passion for what he teaches.  Always an interesting and enjoyable class to attend.

He is really nice and obviously extremely knowledgable about Russian Lit.  He seems to really enjoy teaching which is always a nice attribute in a professor.  I love going to his class because he just seems so darn happy all the time and has a wonderful (and actually very easy to understand) Russian accent.
Very knowledgeable. Very interesting. Accent a delight to listen to. Has an accent and stutters a bit, but does not detract much from his overall clarity.
Very Russian. Stutters a lot, and can be slow or pound things in quite a bit, but he makes sense. Just make sure you read some of the book before going to lecture, or you'll get lost quickly.
Awesome professor! Great literature, very knowledgable. Just an overall great, wonderful guy.
very knowledgable in both nabokov and dostoevsky.  an unbelievably likeable guy. makes class exactly what you'd like a class to be
No Comments
If you need a lit class and don't mind taking Russian lit take a class with this professor.  He's great! Very interesting very clear. His class was one of the best classes I've ever taken.
